revisions.rev:
{{coord|55.852|-4.309|display=title|region:GB_scale:5000}} The '''Rangers F.C. Hall of Fame''' is a list established in 2000 by the then [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] chairman, [[David Murray (Scottish businessman)|Sir David Murray]], to honour the club's notable players. Each year more names are added by a panel consisting of selected ex-Rangers legends. The current members are [[John Greig]], [[Sandy Jardine]] and [[Ally McCoist]], all of whom are themselves [[Hall of Fame]] members, club [[historian]] David Mason, Jim Templeton, President of the Rangers Supporters Assembly and David Murray himself. ==Criteria== The following five criteria are considered by the panel when selecting new members. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:100%; text-align:center" !#!!Criterion |- |1|| {{left}} Service to the club |- |2|| {{left}} Appearances made |- |3|| {{left}} Honours won |- |4|| {{left}} International caps gained whilst at the club |- |5|| {{left}} Exceptional ability |} ==Members== (Jimmy Bowie, Ally Dawson, Arthur Dixon, Jock Drummond, Neilly Gibson, Robert Hamilton, George Niven and Jimmy Simpson, David Weir) There are currently 81 members: {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:100%; text-align:center" !#!!Player!!Position!!Rangers career!!Appearances!!Honours!!Caps |- |1|| {{left}} {{Sort|MacNeil, Moses|{{flagicon|SCO}} [[Moses McNeil]]}}||MF||1872â1882||34|| ||2 |- |2|| {{left}} {{Sort|MacNeil, Peter|{{flagicon|SCO}} [[Peter McNeil]]}}||MF||1872â1877||7|| ||0 |- |3|| {{left}} {{Sort|Campbell, Peter|{{flagicon|SCO}} [[Peter Campbell (footballer)|Peter Campbell]]}}||FW||1872â1879||24|| ||2 |- |4|| {{left}} {{Sort|MacBeath, William|{{flagicon|SCO}} [[William McBeath]]}}||MF||1872â1876||5||||0 |- |5|| {{left}} {{Sort|Vallance, Tom|{{flagicon|SCO}} [[Tom Vallance]]}}||DF||1877â1884||38||||6 |- |6|| {{left}} {{Sort|MacPherson, John|{{flagicon|SCO}} [[John McPherson (footballer)|John McPherson]]}}||FW||1891â1902||281||[[Scottish Premier League|League]] (5)
